Name: The King's Guild: Ascend the Dice Tower
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

A new quest card

Name: Movie Clichés: Action Edition
Description:
Some movie clichés are necessary, others just the result of lazy screenwriting. But they're always fun to predict and spot! That's why we turned 75 of them into playing cards!

Two styles of play ("Cliché Bingo" and "Name the Movies") are the meat of the game - but you can surely come up with different scenarios.

The Action Edition is available as a standalone edition and as part of the complete edition (action, horror, comedy, sci-fi and fantasy clichés).

—description from the designer

Name: Movie Clichés: Horror Edition
Description:
Some movie clichés are necessary, others just the result of lazy screenwriting. But they're always fun to predict and spot! That's why we turned 75 of them into playing cards!

Two styles of play ("Cliché Bingo" and "Name the Movies") are the meat of the game - but you can surely come up with different scenarios.

The Horror Edition is available as a standalone edition and as part of the complete edition (action, horror, comedy, sci-fi and fantasy clichés).

—description from the designer

Name: GearMan GO!: Expansion Pack
Description:
It's the marvelous, it's the super, it's the amazing... GearMan GO! Expansion Pack! A fun comic book race game for 2 to 6 players of all ages.

Expansion Pack includes white & black cars with their gear tiles, gear cubes, lap cubes and lap tile. Nineteen more track tiles with grass on the reverse including the new hairpin tile. Requires GearMan GO! base game.

Races are unique each time with the random Action spaces, modular hex track boards, cars bumping and changing gears.

Cars are driven by rolling various black and white Gear dice looking for doubles. Move your car one space for each dice of each double thrown into the matching color space on the track.

Try to stay in the highest gear possible by avoiding the POW and BOMB spaces. The lower your gear the less dice you roll. Drive over the WOW and SUPER spaces to gear up or boost to top gear!

Customize and build your own circuits with the modular hex boards with further playability added by the GearMan GO! Expansion Pack which extends the circuit with more hex board straights & curves and adds two additional cars bringing the total players up to six.

Races can comprise of 1 to 3 laps. First player to complete the set laps wins.

Name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder on Paradise Island
Description:
The time is the present and Carrie Bean, owner of the proposed new all-inclusive resort "Flip-Flops" has invited her guests to a house party at the Cliff House Hotel & Restaurant on the beautiful West Indian island of Paradise.  Before the party Carrie Bean took her usual afternoon stroll along the clifftop but a short while later she was found floating in the Caribbean sea.  Host your own party and find out who is responsible for the murder on Paradise island.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Arcade Inc
Description:
A card game where in the players attempt to build the most successful arcade by building new machines and drawing in people from the community. they can also sabotage the other players machines by placing them out of order.

On the players turn they can either play a machine/upgrade into their arcade. Or they can place a meeple from the community onto an existing machine/upgrade.

Out of order/repaired cards can be played at anytime to effect machines in play.

When the first player has 6 machines in their arcade the game is over and a meeple count determines the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: What To Where!?
Description:
You're going places! But what you take on your journey isn't up to you to decide, and the the people who are "packing your bag" don't know exactly where you're going. Still, they're doing their best, and you'll pick the person who packs the best combination of items for you. Between you, you'll figure out What goes to Where.

What To Where!? is a hilarious party game of questions, answers, and storytelling.

The game is played in rounds - play one round or play 20, whatever you want. Each round, one player (called the Traveler) secretly takes a Destination card which indicates where they're going. The other players have a predetermined number of Question Actions denoted by chips, and in the center of the table a pile of Item Tiles, all unique. All at the same time, the players who are not the Traveler sift through the Items, trying to pick the very best set of four for the Traveler to take with them. Meanwhile, the players may cash in chips to ask limited Questions that will narrow down where the Traveler is going.

Once all of the Question Actions have been taken (all the chips spent), the Traveler reveals their Destination and all players reveal the Items they selected. Then everyone gets a chance to tell a story to justify why they picked what they did. The Traveler chooses who "packed" the set of items and declares that player the winner for the round.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombie World: Enclave Expansion – The Mall
Description:
Welcome to the Mall

A temple to capitalism and a fortress against the dead. Maybe this place will help keep you alive, so long as you don't mind living off the food court for a while.

The Mall Enclave Expansion for ZOMBIE WORLD adds a whole new enclave you can use in any session of the tabletop roleplaying game, with new options, characters, and possibilities for your game.

Includes: 18 Population cards, 27 Identity cards, 4 Advantage cards, 4 Fate cards, & 2 Enclave cards

From the back of the box

Name: City of Gears: Dice Tower Promo Tile
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Every Player rolls 1 die, Gain 4 victory points for each result which matches the result you rolled ( including the one you rolled).

Name: Farting Cows And The End Of The World
Description:
Gas building up around the cows eventually might explode! Spread them out before we're all killed!

The community is concerned about all the gas building up around the cows. Eventually it might explode! Move your cows to an open pasture where they can air out their farts before they kill us all!

You will each start with a set of cows and terrain cards. Each turn, you will either place a terrain card or maneuver a cow. The cows will each take up a different amount of space. Terrain also varies in usable space. Terrain that allows more maneuverability is worth more victory points at the end of the game. Cows are movable as long as they aren’t farting. Once they are farting, they are won’t be movable for the remainder of the game. Cows can also take up more of the usable terrain space by farting, so time those gaseous releases appropriately. The game ends after any player places their last terrain card on the table, with one final turn for each other player. After that, the player having the most cows on any given terrain card will claim the victory points for the space.

—description from designer

Name: Presto! Presto!
Description: A fast paced word game. Everyone plays at the same time, trying to sort cards into a predefined order based on the letters included of the depicted object.

Name: Yacht Club
Description:
Players are influential socialites and moguls in their world of excess, who enjoy impressing each other with their bottomless wealth. They will try to one-up each other bidding during auctions, designing and building the most luxurious yachts, and also engage in a bit of "take that". Players will wheel and deal, swindle and steal ... stepping on one another as they climb the ladder to success.

Whoever owns the most prestigious fleet in the Yacht Club at the end of the game will be the envy of the "1 %".

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Rose Wars: Supreme Invocation Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Up to 5 models (Mages or Evocations) in the lodge can act immediately under your control. This includes your Evocations but not yourself

-or-

Summon up to 3 different Evocations from the ones available in play, in 3 different Rooms. You cannot summon Evocations derived from the Forgotten magic school.

Name: Reef: Bonus Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Included are 4 new bonus cards that involve a new symbol. The top half of all of the cards contain a question mark symbol, when you're taking coral pieces instead take one coral piece of ANY COLOR from the top of ANY of your STACKS.

Name: Killjoy: Pocket Play
Description:
Killjoy: Pocket Play is the anti-party game. This 52-card game is an action-packed good time for 2-4 players.

Jerry is the guy from work who throws the worst parties. When you tell him you can't go, he starts asking questions.

Your goal is to be the first player to escape Jerry's party by answering all 3 of his questions with appropriate excuses.

But, move quickly! Your friends don't plan on going either, and they might notice you experiencing things like a Panic Attack or Sweaty Palms.

The first player to escape 3 parties will be crowned the ultimate killjoy.

Great for non-gamers, new gamers, light gamers, and anyone wanting a quick fun round!

—description from the designer

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Fires of Pompeii
Description: This expansion adds characters from The Fires of Pompeii episode to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three faction cards, and two new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Ninth Doctor & Companions
Description: This expansion adds the Ninth Doctor and some of his companions to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, five faction cards, and seven new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Papal Mainframe
Description: This expansion adds characters from the Church of the Papal Mainframe to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – I am The Master
Description: This expansion adds five different incarnations of The Master to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, five faction cards, and two new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat – New Pilot Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 2 new pilot cards: Danny Hubbard & Kaspar Masaharu

Name: Pauv' Mery
Description:
Pauv'Mery is a parkour game. The goal of the game is to make the number of tour of the island agreed at the beginning (1, 2 or 3 rounds). The first explorer to perform the tricks wins the game. The dice is used by the other players can influence the final move.
—user summary

A handful of adventurers explore the island with the lush flora and fauna of Pauv 'Mery.
They will realize quickly that this journey requires to use strategies, alliances and defense to be the first to have explored this distant country ..
—description from the back of the box (translated)

Une poignée d'aventuriers part à la découverte de l'île à la faune et à la flore luxuriantes de Mauv' Mery.
Ils réaliseront rapidement que ce périple nécessitera de jouer de stratégies, d'alliances et de défense pour parvenir à être le premier à avoir exploré cette lointaine contrée...
—description from the back of the box

Name: Ghost In The Shell: Stand Alone Complex – The Game
Description:
The Laughing Man, a mysterious criminal, is terrorizing the city of Niihama. Will Section 9 agents be able to contain the threat in this first board game adaptation of legendary anime Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex?

In a near future where the frontier between humankind and machines has almost disappeared, a mysterious criminal known as The Faceless tries to create chaos and terror among the inhabitants of the Japanese city of Niihama. Only Section 9, an elite task force of military officers and police detectives who deal with cybercrimes and terrorist threats can prevent the fall of the city. This is war, and only one side will triumph!

For the first time ever, Ghost in The Shell becomes a boardgame
Asymmetric gameplay: one player is the the Laughing Man, the others must work together as Section 9 to save the city from the attacks.
A vividly illustrated game featuring a modular game board, finely crafted miniatures and a robust deckbuilding system.

Hard decisions for both sides!

—description from the publisher

Name: NFL Five
Description:
GAME SYSTEM

    
    
         This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.

    



The NFL Five TCG allows you to construct your own fantasy dream team and compete against other decks – fusing a traditional TCG gameplay experience with Panini’s iconic NFL trading cards! Aside from fielding your favorite Players, you’ll also call Plays by placing them facedown (along with your opponent choosing a defense). Successful plays will gain yardage (tracked on the football field play-mat!), which can then be modified by Player abilities and Action cards. Plays also take time off the clock, which can be managed with timeouts. After two halves of play, the highest score wins the game!—description from the publisher

Name: Developing the Portable Wargame
Description: A further book that expands Bob Cordery's Portable Wargame system, featuring small and quick games on square or hex-grid terrain.  This contains rules for ancient warfare and aerial warfare in the first half of the twentieth century.  It also contains additional and optional rules for the rulesets featured in the previous "The Portable Wargame" book.  The book concludes with some example mini-campaigns and scenarios.

Name: Smart Ass Geek Chic
Description:
If you’re a little geeky, you know tech hot spots and your bits from your bytes. Your heroes might even be scientists. Don’t wait—yell out the answer as soon as you know it! Get your geek on! Geek Chic works great as a standalone card game, or as an expansion pack for the Smart Ass board game.

Players take turns asking trivia questions from the deck of Question Cards. Question Cards come in three categories: What Am I?, Where Am I?, and Who Am I? The starting player begins to read the eight clues on the Question Card aloud while all other players yell out their answers (they each get one shot at the correct answer). The player who answers the question correctly keeps that Question Card. If no player answers correctly, the reader keeps the Question Card. Play passes to the left. The first player to collect four Question Cards wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aventuria: Ship of Stone Promo Pack
Description:
In this promopack for the collection box "The Stone Ship" we offer you the two alternative heroes Traute Blattpflüger (Peraine Consecrated) and Thurbold Paskalson (Thorwal Warrior) as well as the fighting environment "Extreme Imp Compulsion", with which you can make the adventure even more challenging!
—description from the publisher (translated)

In diesem Promopack für die Sammelbox "Das Steinerne Schiff" bieten wir euch die beiden alternativen Helden Traute Blattpflüger (Perainegeweihte) und Thurbold Paskalson (Thorwalscher Krieger) sowie die Kampfumgebung "Extremer Koboldzwang", mit dem ihr das Abenteuer noch herausfordernder gestalten könnt!
—description from the publisher

Name: Autarch: The Age of Blood and Glory
Description:
The Autarchs are sadistic creatures.
You should know, being one of them. Galactic Wars have made you the rulers of the known worlds, but now the High Autarch is seeking a new, worthy pastime. Welcome to the Age of Blood and Glory, where you and your opponents will send your fighters to the epic re-enactments of the infamous wars, in the hope of finding favour with the High Autarch.

Autarch: The Age of Blood and Glory is an asymmetric PvP arena combat miniature tabletop for 1-4 players, also playable as skirmish, with additional worker placement preparation phase which builds the campaign potential of the game.

With two games in one, your journey will alter between merciless arena battles, based on unique dice-less card combat, providing both a macabre and fun experience; and worker-placement phases, where you will strategize your next steps in a push-your-luck environment.

Battles are played in a modular arena with different fighter races, developed by advanced deck-building through character leveling and equipping different items. Main mechanics which make up the unique and challenging experience of Autarch include:

     Initiative Dial mechanism creates a dynamic player order, depending on the played cards;
     Threat Level defines how much each fighter is worth in every attack, making it less opportunistic to focus on the weaker ones;
     Dice-replacement Power deck represents effort a player is willing to invest in all of his actions. As both the attacker and the defender will have to use Power, you will not only have to make trade offs between offense and defense, but also test your bluffing skills in an effort to read through your opponent’s secret intentions;
     Player’s hand being the target of attacks (selected randomly by opponents during successful attacks), with your initial hand being comprised of combat- and defense cards, and clogged with wounds as you get damaged, which may inflict you with permanent injuries. 


—description from the publisher

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Nimue The Blood Queen
Description:
The Blood Queen is here! Nimue is a limited edition expansion for Hellboy: The Board Game.

Hailing from the time of King Arthur, Nimue was beloved by the wizard Merlin. After betraying him and slowly going insane, she turned to worshipping the Ogdru Jahad and was subsequently slain by her fellow witches. Later resurrected, she became a formidable adversary of Hellboy.

Contents:

1 Resin Miniature, Rules Card, Boss Card, Deck of Doom Card and 2 Boss Behaviour Cards.

Name: MUSA
Description:
Color matching hexagonal card game. Deck consists of sixty cards.

The hexagonal cards are divided into six colors per card out of a possible nine colors.

GAME PLAY


     2 to 4 players are dealt 7 cards each,
     5 to 7 players are dealt 5 cards each.


Players take turns dealing, person to the left of the dealer goes first. Game starts by player one laying a card face up on the table and drawing a card from the deck. Player two tries to match color to color, then, the next player and so on, the winner is the first one to play all their cards, white wedge is a wild color, black wedge blocks any match. If a player matches.


     ONE color you draw a card and your turn ends 
     TWO colors, you don’t draw a card and your turn ends 
     THREE colors, you don’t draw a card and you get to take another turn 
     FOUR colors, you give a player of choice one of your care   and you get to take another turn 
     FIVE colors and you automatically win the game 
     (SIX colors and you win this and the next six games, there is no need to play them.)

Name: Aeon Trespass: Odyssey – Skyseer Titan
Description:
The Nyx/Skyseeker Titan pack comes with an awesome mini, an oversized Titan Sheet and two unique Weapon/Gear cards, as well as an Introductory adventure and surprises!

The Skyseeker Titan is a late game Titan, unlockable through the Mnestis Theatre. With the Flight ability, it’ll prove mighty handy against the likes of Hermesian Pursuer, Hypertime Oracle and the formidable Sun Descendant, as well as the denizens of Eternal Persia, with the cruel Babelian Lunacy on the top of the list!

Name: Crowbar!: The Rangers at Pointe Du Hoc – Vorwarts!
Description: "Vorwarts!" is a complete, boxed wargame expansion for Crowbar. The expansion includes a sheet of new counters, including Ranger machine gun emplacements, German offensive units, and much more. Also included are six beautiful new scenarios including a shortened main scenario, smaller scenarios for each of the Ranger companies, and two counterattack scenarios in which you play as the German, counterattacking the Ranger positions. The expansion also comes with a rules booklet and a pretty box to keep it all safe.

Name: Titan Dice: The Fires of Olympus
Description:
From the publisher:

This expansion allows a 5th player to join any game of Titan Dice.

Components:
1 Player Board
5 Creature Cards
5 Creature Markers
6 Titan Dice
1 Player Aids/Attack Cards
2 Wound Markers

Requires Titan Dice to play.

Name: Robo Junkyard
Description:
Robo Junkyard is a fast-paced game about getting rid of all of your cards (junk) faster than all of the other robots! Count cards and strategize, push junk onto other robots, or just blow up the pile entirely. Do what it takes to get those shiny victory credits!
description from the publisher's website

Robo Junkyard is a card shedding game. Each player chooses a robot which has a 12 card deck associated with it. Each deck is identical except for one card unique to that robot. Players set up by placing four cards in their Extra Stack (cards in the Extra Stack will be added to a players hand later in the round), one card in the Collection (a shared pool of hidden cards that players don't need to get rid of), and the rest of the cards in their hand.

Gameplay consists of players taking turns playing cards into a pile in the center of the play area, or, if they cannot play a card, picking up the pile and adding the cards into their hand. Each card has an ability that might do things like blow up the pile, skip player's turns, or tamper with cards in the collection.

Players who get rid of all of their cards earn victory credits. The first robot to receive six is crowned the winner!

-description from designer

Name: Philadelphia 1777
Description:
Philadelphia 1777 is a board wargame about the American Revolutionary War campaign led by British General Howe against the American colonist led by General Washington. It is a point to point movement war game using blocks with labels for the military units. The game uses the system from our previous games, New York 1776, Trenton 1776, and Saratoga 1777.

Each turn both the American and British player will receive activation points with which to activate either groups of blocks moved by a leader, or individual blocks. When blocks of both sides end a move in a location together then a battle occurs.

The game has some excellent historical “chrome” mixed in.

There are lots of great strategic decisions for both sides in the game. Best of all it plays in 2 hours so you have time to play two games in an evening.

—description from the designer

Name: Creed
Description:
The world wants peace, but the humans cross swords with each other. The peace will come only after a bloodbath.

The boardgame Creed is a strategic medieval war game using AP system. It's a game in which four kingdoms cross swords at each other insisting their own beliefs.

Players pick one of four kingdoms and lead the armies in the battle field. You will deploy your units to fight on six lanes and try to find and take away the opponent’s king and the commander-in-chief hiding in the camp while protecting your own.

In order to win the game, you need to understand the specialty of each unit. And you have to use your action points as efficiently as possible. Sometimes you have to crouch down and save your action points, so you can throw a big punch later. There are some special actions that can help you achieve glory, but you are allow to use them only once or twice during the game.

Every order you make is critical! Can you lead your army to victory?

The game has play time of 30 to 45 minutes and can be played 1vs1 or 2vs2.

Each kingdom has a very distinctive special unit and background story.

Phoenixia is the most powerful empire in military power. Their heavy armored cavalries are the worst nightmare for the enemies.

Xervin is the united kingdom of hunter tribes. With a good knowledge of projectiles, they’ve developed a bow-shooting machine, ballista.

Zuden is the kingdom of loyalty and fidelity. The Royal Knights who are armed with large shields and swords will never retreat from the battle fields.

Magatias is a mysterious and shadowy kingdom. They might be inferior in power, but they have assassins who can easily infiltrate into enemy’s base.

Name: Keeper of the Wurdz
Description:
The object of the game is to play four of your words from your word cards out onto the board, and score a higher number of points than any other player when the game ends. Each player has 4 word cards, each with 4 words on it and each word 5 letters long. However, each word is an English word spelled out phonetically. On a player's turn they play one of their words out to the board using the letter tiles, similar to Scrabble except players have access to all letters at all times. Once a word is played all other players can make 3 guesses among them what they think the words actually is. If they fail to say the word correctly, the current player earns an additional 10 points. Regardless, players earn points when placing words based on the squares on the board they lay their words. After four rounds, the player with the most points is the winner.

This is game #5 of a series from Things Unlimited.

Name: Monster Problemen
Description:
Monster Problemen ("Monster Problems") is ‘serious’ card game for age 8 and older in which players learn about problems caused by poverty and potential solutions for such situations. This is done by seeing text one side of the cards, the other side shows monster heads (problems) and limbs (solutions) that can be combined if they are of the appropriate color (type).

Cards are drafted from an open tableau, with 2 cards per player per round being offered, plus 1 starting player card that can be taken. Players choose 2 cards during their turn. Then flip over the cards to see the monster head or limbs. Monsters heads need 2 to 4 limbs to be completed. At any time players can rearrange their monster heads and limbs. If the drawing pile is too small to fill up the open drafting tableau the game immediately ends. Each completed monster is worth point equal the amount of cards it consists of. The player with the most points wins the game.

This is a co-creations with the Kids Council of the municipality of Groningen. The game will be distributed to primary schools in the city. Drawings are made by the Kids Council. Graphic design and art implementation done by Marco Westerkamp.

—description from the designer

Name: Saboteur: Das Stollenfest
Description:
Postcard for Saboteur (basic game) and Saboteur 2 (expansion).
Effect: when connection is made, all players switch roles.

Name: Monster Lands: Aleaturrim Promo Card
Description:
A promo made for the Dice Tower Kickstarter project 2019.

The reviewer icon works as a joker for affinity purposes. The land can be settled by a mercenary of ANY affinity, and the Land counts as ANY 1 affinity in the end-of-game victory point count.

Name: Terra Incognita: Real Theory of Everything
Description:
Terra Incognita: Real Theory of Everything is a game in which players represent one of two factions: scientists or conspiracy theorists. They must decide once and forever: is Earth flat or spherical?

During the game, players build a deck by selecting the appropriate cards from one of the factions. In this way, players can accumulate points of Hidden Truths or Science which can then be used to change the world. Literally!

Points of Hidden Truths and Science allow the player to buy tiles that are used to build a map of the whole world. It’s up to them if Earth will be flat or not! It ensures appropriate actions which can strengthen your decks.

At the very end – there can only be one winner! The person who wins is going to be the most powerful and - very likely - will change the face of the world forever!

Highlights:

     A great combination of classical deck-building mixed with tile-placement game. The world hasn’t seen something like that yet! Call your mom, call your boss, and gather a team to play! The unique, fresh mechanics and immersive experience of a dynamic, interesting play for gamers on every age is seriously mind blowing! You simply cannot miss that. 
     An incredible sense of humor - get your sores ointment ready, because as a result of compulsive laughter caused by the game you will have to lubricate your cheeks and stomach!
     Be whoever you want in the game - we won’t judge! 


Do you want to prove that Earth is flat, vaccines cause autism, governments poison us using chemtrails, UFO kidnaps people, everything is caused by Illuminati, Big Foot and Loch Ness Monster exist? Now you can! 
Do you want to save the world from these above and you believe in science? In this game you can even land on Mars and design a new cancer vaccine to benefit mankind, so let’s go!

—description from the publisher

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Radio Times
Description:
A special edition of the original Trivial Pursuit themed around the 'Radio Times', a British TV listings magazine. Players move around a simplified Trivial Pursuit board answering questions and collecting wedges; the first to collect all the wedges and answer a final question in the middle of the board wins.

The categories in this edition include 'Entertainment & Childrens' TV', 'Radio', 'Film', 'Events and Documentaries', 'Comedy', and 'Drama & Soap'.

Name: Mind's Eye
Description:
Mind’s Eye is a 2-3 player staring contest game made of 18 identical cards.

Players simultaneously play a single card pointing the colored eyes they wish to use towards the other player(s). Winners will take the losers cards based on the color of the eye. Play until all the cards are in one player’s hands. That player is now the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Let's Sort It Out
Description:
In Let's Sort It Out take turns picking and sorting recyclables, trash and compost to gain points in this set-collection game. Watch as they come down the conveyor belt. Collect the best cards to fill your bins. But watch out for hazardous materials! They will contaminate your hand and hinder you in the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Raccoon Tycoon: New Town Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available at Gen Con 2019 as well as for backers of The Dice Tower Kickstarter 2019.

The pack contains 4 new town cards for the game.

Name: Save the Whales
Description:
An exciting game played on the high seas to save the world's threatened whale population.

Drop anchor in Pago Pago, Darwin, Amchitka. Fiji, and other interesting ports of call.

Navigate the far reaches of the Pacific in search of whaling fleets.

Contains two versions: 1 for 8 years and Up, II for 12 years and up.

Contains playing board of the Pacific Ocean, 2 dice, 8 plastic ships, 32 whale cards, 29 Davy Jones Locker cards, 16 confrontation cards, and a rule sheet,

Name: Gaïa: Paquet Promotionnel
Description:
This mini pack includes 8 new city cards for the first or second edition of Gaïa:
the Brandenburg Gate, Paris, the Forbidden City, New York, Saint Petersburg, Biskupin, Cracovia and Venice.
The first seven replace the cities of the game having the same characteristics (these are alternative illustrations). Venice is an additional city, to add to the Life cards. This is the only city to be laid on a Sea tile.
This pack is included in the third edition of the game.

Name: Deusastrados
Description:
The entity known as Chaos began the formation of a new planet an attracted the attention of the whole cosmos. From every corner of the universe, the gods of creation came together for a big competition!

In Deusastrados, players assume the role of these gods, striving to fulfill the orders of Chaos and generate the best and most adapted creatures to populate the new planet.

Rounds in Deusastrados are divided into four phases:

CREATION
Players, in real-time and simultaneously, draw creature parts cards from the center of the table and use them to build their creatures, or to sabotage their opponents' creatures.

POWERS
Players check their god's available power cards and choose one to lay face-down on the table. All of them are revealed simultaneously and they are activated in order of priority.

CHAOS
All creatures with parts unwanted by Chaos discard those parts.

SCORING
The remaining creatures and parts score, following the rules.

Deusastrados has a basic mode and an asymmetrical one, in which each god has his own ability and distinct powers.

Name: Worldly Wise Shout Out
Description: Trivia game created in the UK. A 'pick-up sticks' style. The first person picks up a stick and reads it aloud. First person to shout a correct answer wins the stick. That person grabs another stick and reads the trivia question. Person with the most sticks wins.

Name: Soothsayer
Description:
The Head Oracle is gravely ill. A terrible storm has torn through the land, filling the people with fear. They turn to you; oracles of the temple, sacred predictors of the future. You must guide them.

You will take on the roll of oracles and vie for the favor of the ailing head of your temple. Constellation cards dictate star patterns you must create on the shared board, but also possible interpretations for the prophecy; matching these carefully to create the oracles' signature rhyming couplets will lead to victory.

If you survey the board and do not like your odds for the future, you may also turn to the past for aid. Each game one of ten possible supplicants will be chosen at the beginning of play. Their branching past will be revealed as cards are played, and with it, shrines offering powerful abilities will awaken.

View the past, predict the future, and outwit your opponents to prove yourself worthy of becoming the next Head Oracle.

-description from the designer

Name: Sell Outs
Description:
A game about saying anything to get a sale. Sell Outs is a tabletop card game about solving curious problems with absurd creative solutions! This turn-based game is best with 3-7 players, but can be played with more.

Are you plagued by honey badgers? Not getting that raise you want at work? Have you ever had trouble starting a revolution? Everyone has problems. Now you have solutions!

Sell Outs is the game of solving your friend’s problems by pitching common items with odd features!
A crane that grants wishes that always backfire. A spaceship that does not need any fuel, but flies really slowly. A rabbit’s foot that doubles as a great wingman. Anything is possible when you Sell Out!

—description from the publisher

Name: Board Game Cafe Frenzy: Kickstarter Promo Pack
Description:
This is a set of items for Board Game Cafe Frenzy that were available during the Kickstarter campaign.

The set contains items below:


     10 Store board cards
     1 Essen'19 store board card
     5 Level 4 customers
     7 Essen Spiel'19 objective mini-expansion cards
     1 set of store manager mini-expansion


Store manager mini-expansion contains 6 store manager tokens and 4 coins (value:3).

—description from the designer

Name: Esquire
Description:
So, you want to be the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court? Well, that is long road for a lowly First Year law student.  You will need climb the partnership ladder, schmooze clients, and . . . well, win some cases, of course. All you need to do is advance 11 Levels, through 11 increasing areas of Practice, while engaging in 22 different Cases and acquiring up to 15 different Skills. Sound like a lot to track? Nonsense! It is all contained on ONE page.  You roll. You write.  Hopefully, you advance . . . or at least survive another Friday . . . on second thought, better dust off that resume. This takes the One Page In A Life Series (OPIAL Series) into the realm of reality . . . sort of . . . .

—description from the designer

Name: Build Me: The Architect Game
Description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to build a 16-floor building. At the same time, players will attempt to prevent their opponents from reaching their 16th floor. The first player to build their 16th floor and also hold the "Finished Building" card will be the winner.

Apart from the tiles used for the buildings, there are also cards which are used to defend against other players. Attacks are also played through cards, including snowstorms, worker strikes, and lack of concrete, among other problems.

—user summary

Name: The Treasures in Anubis Tomb
Description:
Rumor has it that there are precious treasures in anubis tomb. As a secret agent, you are dispatched to the tomb and try to access those treasures. Unfortunately, you are not alone. Another agent has already skulk into the tomb. He/She might ruin your plan!

To steal out all the treasures, you found that you need to complete the mysterious board in the tomb. Place treasures to the board sounds easy, but the treasures are cursed, the chambers stumble at every step and the mummy has woken! Everything is getting worse and dangerous.

The Treasures in Anubis Tomb is a 2 player game, which is playing 45 minutes. A game plays 3 phases and each phase plays 4 rounds. Each round, each player takes turn to take a treasure from the tomb and place the treasure on their board, which consists of a 4x4 grid area. After placing the treasure and depending on the number and color shown on the tile, player is allowed to take a card from pyramid chamber to score points.

As the game goes, players try to increase their scoring round by round and level by level. Because each round the mummy moves forward to chase players on the scoring track. If player couldn’t manage to score more points as game moves, they probably will get caught and get punishment by mummy! Take the useful treasures and place them with plan. Then you might successfully move all the treasures from the tomb and win the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Money On FIRE
Description:
People today spend much of their time on their undervalued, uninteresting daily work. Whether it is to achieve a better standard of living, improving their homes, their health, or supporting their children’s career, for many this might mean delaying the full enjoyment of their own life and long-held dreams. Financial independence is more important than ever. Proper, well-made investments can increase the value of your assets and earn you profit. Smart investment of that profit can eventually help you achieve financial independence.

In Money On FIRE, the goal is financial independence. Each player has three targets represented by three cards. Once any player fulfills all three targets set out in their cards, and so becomes financially independent, they win the game. Two to four players can choose different ways to invest, such as the property investment, building up their own business to win the best possible contracts, investing time to level up their professional knowledge in a tech tree, making investments in bonds and so on, all to build the most efficient investment portfolio.

—description from the designer

Name: Spell Clash
Description:
Two players represent wizard apprentices who have recovered 18 scrolls of parchment from an ancient tome. Along the edges of each scroll are engraved runes of power. Players will arrange scrolls from their hands such that runes align to form powerful incantations, which will score them prestige and, depending on the color and arrangement of the runes, grant them special magical abilities as well. The object for each apprentice is to demonstrate superior mastery of the arcane scrolls and thus prove their mettle as the most accomplished wizard.

This game was developed as an entry for the ButtonShy September 2019 game design challenge- the restriction was that each of the 18 cards must be identical to one another.

—description from the designer

Name: Shadowrun: Sprawl Ops – Dice Tower Kickstarter 2019 Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 2 promo cards: 
Loaded Dice - set any one die to any result after rolling
Break in on the 42nd Floor

Name: Pentris
Description:
Each player get a 10x10 squares grid. Two Tetris-like pentominoes are associated with each numbers 1 to 6.
The game is played in real time: a dice throw determines a combination of two pentominoes, each player must choose one and draw it on his/her sheet connected to the bottom or on top of preexisting full squares in a gravity-affected fashion. The shapes can be rotated at will before being drawn. At the end of the round, player rotate their sheet 90° clockwise. Repeat until every player can't place a piece during a round.
The number of completed columns OR rows gives the score. The player(s) with the highest score win(s).

Name: Jungle Rumble: Meowtopia – Promo Personal Board & Kitten Tiles
Description: Add one more personal board and 6 kitten tiles.

Name: Halloween Party
Description:
Halloween Party, a competitive game for 2 to 5 players in which adopting the role of one of the Darkest Lords of the classical horror stories you will compete with the rest of the players to find out who is the most powerful. Through the use of spells and sinister abilities, try to get the greatest number of allies before the end of the night so that you can be crowned as the most powerful Dark Lord. Will you get Froncostin to join your side? Will you persuade Aigor to serve you? Will you make Vampirina part of your cohort?

A great deal of creatures populate the world of Halloween Party, all willing to give you a terrifyingly good time. Let yourself be hypnotized by the beauty of Vampirina, enjoy a show with Audrey III, go to Dr. Jeckill's office or explore the darkest neighbourhoods with Ratman. There is no reason not to have any of these new friends by your side... or is there?
A wide variety of Spells, abilities and dark powers give endless possibilities to play many different games and propose the most varied strategies.
Major spells can change the outcome of the game in a radical way, do not use them in a crazy way because they can give you the victory at the most unexpected moment.

36 Creature cards, 50 minor spell cards with a great variety of different spells, 6 major spell cards, 6 Dark Lord's character sheets to choose from and endless fun moments await you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kutu Buku: A Game of Nerdy Talks
Description: Kutu Buku: A Game of Nerdy Talk is a social-party game that combines the elements of trivia game with bluffing. In turns, players will be the Active Player who talks about certain topic. Active Player has to choose whether they want to tell the story truthfully or fabricate it. The other players will discuss it, then they will vote either the story is a fact or faked. Active Player and others who guess correctly will get point(s) as many as the number of players who guess otherwise. Try not to be too predictable, since if all the players voted unanimously and correctly, you will get penalty! The game will run until 2 rounds, or 1 round if we play with 6-8 players.

Name: Moonshiners of the Apocalypse: Event Cards
Description:
Event cards are an optional component of the game.
Playing with them changes the experience by adding events at every move you make on the board. Thus certain decision and strategies will be altered.

Pack was available as an add on during the kickstarter campaign.

Name: Sub Terra II: Arima's Light
Description:
The Arima's Light expansion for Sub Terra II introduces 5 new characters for explorers to play as, the Magician, the Escape Artist, the Fortune Teller, the Strongman, and the Beastmaster (who also comes with a hound!). Along with these new unusual and intriguing characters Arima's light introduces a 'prequel' game mode where an original cast of characters attempt to lock away the evil magic of Typhaon, the volcanic spirit.

New characters, new game mode, and new hazard tiles to contend with.

Name: Sub Terra II: Typhaon Wakes
Description:
In the Typhaon Wakes expansion for Sub Terra II, players are introduced to three new types of guardian to contend with in their quest to extract the mysterious artifact.

Volatile guardians that can explode and cause massive damage, ranged guardians that can attack from afar, and the eternal guardian, who will not rest until you are gone from the temple.

In addition to these new guardian types and several new tile types, players will also have access to a new one vs many mode, where one player takes the role of the spirit of the mountain, Typhaon.

This player will control the resolution of hazards at the end of explorer player turns using a light handbuilding mechanic. This gives that player control over the evil machinations of the mountain.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fresco: Mega Box
Description:
Dive into the magnificent era of the Renaissance, with playing this authentic game including all expansion modules.

You belong to the best fresco painters and are hired to restore the ceiling painting in the cathedral to its former glory. Put your skills to the test to win the bishop’s favour and thus the game.

This Mega Box includes new artwork and combines the basic game with all modules (1-17). These can be combined with the basic game as desired, thus extending the playing possibilities. Each module also influences the duration of the game – for even more and longer lasting fun!

—description from publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Level Up Loot 2
Description:
Level up your collection of Renegade titles with these promo items! They have been hand-picked to add new and unique experiences to your games — some through new game play and some through added ambience.
Contents Summary:

•    Altiplano: Alpaca Rider Role Tile
•    Architects of the West Kingdom: 2 Promo Cards 
•    Clank! In! Space!: Cruel Doctor Promo Card
•    Upgraded Ex Libris: First Player Marker
•    Gates of Delirium: Sacrificial Fire Mini Expansion
•    Junk Orbit: Tours Mini Expansion
•    Lanterns Dice: The Legendary Lakes Scorepad
•    Paladins of the West Kingdom 5 Promo Cards
•    The Tea Dragon Society Card Game: Jasmine First Player Marker
•    Terror Below: Renegade Racer Pawn
•    Time Chase: Time Travel Car Pawn
•    Rules Sheet
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Always Carry Water
Description:
Always Carry Water is a competitive survival card game.

You've crash landed in the Northern Wilderness. You and others have luckily survived the wreck, but nobody is interested in cooperating to survive. Each of you decide to forage and explore for civilization on your own. Manage what you can carry, brave mother nature, and watch out for ruthless survivors.

Oh, and remember... Always Carry Water!

You find yourself with limited food and water. Your turn consists of one action; Forage, Camp, and Explore. Exploring is the only way to progress and yields Exploration cards for your journey. Camping is the best way to obtain resources and rest. While, Foraging is used to sustain when there is no other option.

The first player to gain five Exploration cards to fill their journey, escapes the elements and survives. However, if there is an exhaustion card in the player's journey when it fills, the player overexerts and perishes. Balance resources and energy as you face mother nature and the ruthlessness of other survivors.

—description from the designer

Name: Wingspan: Swift-Start Promo Pack
Description:
Use these 10 new bird cards and 4 guides to help new players learn Wingspan. The guides walk players through the first 4 turns of the first round. The bird cards can be shuffled into the deck for use in non-learning games of Wingspan.

This pack is included in the current version of Wingspan (STM910, see note on the back of the box) but not the original version available from January-August 2019 (STM900).

—description from the publisher

Name: Etherfields: Sphinx Campaign
Description:
The Sphinx is one of the oldest cults and a symbol of wisdom and mystery. Since ancient times, this magnificent creature was a guardian of secret knowledge. In this campaign you will be on a quest to discover a deeply hidden mystery that will bring a revolution to the world ruled under the Sphinx entity... What will it be...? What answers will you need to find...?

In this campaign, gameplay will be an endless maze that players will need to go through. From a components standpoint, you will have labyrinth tiles that you will be able to connect to one another in many different ways to try to pass through. However, if you end up at a dead end, you will need to go back to the start and try again.

Secret knowledge will be very handy here as these tiles will have a lot of hidden mechanics of which you will have no knowledge at the start of the campaign. Only after unlocking some of the Sphinx mysteries, will you see a path in a place you previously thought was a dead end.

Name: 3rd Fleet: Fleet Architecture
Description:
From the Expansion:

"One of 3rd FLEET's limitations as a game is a shortage of scenarios. Other tactical/operational wargames overcome such a shortcoming by offering a system for designing your own(DYO) scenarios. But, for that one needs some manner in which to compare the units of the game. The following is an approximate valuation for each unit in 3rd FLEET based upon relative "combat power", allowing players to customize their own fleets for additional scenarios.

These "purchase points" are given per-unit; the number in parentheses is the number of such counters provided in the game's countermix. If nuclear weapons are to be used, pay the
cost to the right of the slash mark. Players may also purchase damaged units at half-cost. Each player may purchase mines for placement before the start of the match for five points each.

Before the game, the opposing players should agree upon the purchase level for each side, with each side getting the same number of points to work with. Roughly speaking, use 400-1000 points per side for a low-complexity scenario; 1000-3000 points for a scenario of medium length/complexity; and 4000+ points for an advanced scenario. A detailed breakdown of the point values of existing scenarios is provided for comparison purposes in the first sidebar."

It also provides for the following four new scenarios, complete with Special Rules, Game Length, Victory Conditions, and detailed Deployment:

Cuba Libre!
Melee in the Caribbean
Assault on Jamaica
Red SeaLion

This expansion was first published as an article in The General, Vol. 27, No. 2 (1991).

Name: 2nd Fleet: War Under the Midnight Sun
Description:
The one feature that contributes most to 2nd FLEET's attractiveness as a game of strategy is its excellent playability. The sub-systems work very well together, and play flows smoothly even in the Advanced Game. The optional Logistics rules are the worst impediment to playability, but even these manifest themselves only at the end of every third turn; experienced, well-organized players can cope with these
readily enough.

As with all "modem" wargames dealing with hypothetical conflict, 2nd FLEET shares the problem that it must amount to an "educated guess". There is no history against which its accuracy can be closely measured (the recent Gulf War notwithstanding). This situation is especially acute for naval games, as there has yet to be a conflict encompassing all the elements embraced by the FLEET series. For example, although guided missiles, airpower, submarines and surface vessels all took part in the Falklands War, there was no simultaneous use of all four elements of naval power in a coordinated manner by both sides in any single engagement. If 2nd FLEET must be an educated guess, however, then it is a very educated one. Another expert might argue with Joe Balkoski's systemic forecast of modem naval warfare, but until the awful day that the real world provides a real standard to judge by, 2nd FLEET's accuracy stands to be as good as that of any other game on the subject.

There are some areas in which players can afford to experiment with the rules, however. One lies in force deployment. The Readiness Level selected for the Advanced Game scenarios and subsequent die rolls for reinforcement can accelerate or decelerate the arrival of units, but the general pattern of disposition remains the same. As warships and air units can move faster than the political events leading to a superpower conflict, this pattern should not be viewed as rigidly unalterable.

—description from the publisher

The expansion provides variants focusing on deployment options for NATO and the Soviet Union.

—user summary

Name: Some Submarine Second-Guessing
Description:
Trying to decipher the characteristics of modem Russian submarines and their weapons is a tricky proposition. Unlike Soviet-built tanks and aircraft, no Russian first-line submarine has ever been exported to an ally - so no one has ever been captured and analyzed by the Western Powers. And since no Soviet nuclear sub has ever fired a shot in anger, their weapon systems have never been observed under combat
conditions. These factors combine to make anyone's conclusions about the capabilities of Russian submarines subject to considerable debate. Here is an attempt to inflict mine upon the FLEET system.

—description from the publisher

This provides an in-depth look at Soviet submarine capabilities within the FLEET Series, including deep-diving ability, double hulls, titanium hulls, clusterguard, torpedo factors, movement allowance and charts to provide easy to find details.

Name: Light Hunters: Pandora Edition
Description:
Light Hunters is a team-based fighting game set in a heroic fantasy universe. The aim of the game is to crush the other team. In order to do that, you select a hero belonging to one of the 4 classes available: tank, fighter, healer or spellcaster.

Light Hunters is the perfect game to ruin a friendship or to decide who will do the chores in your relationship. Opening the game is like opening a famous ancient box…

Pandora Edition is exclusive to the Kickstarter campaign, the box art has been redesigned and an holographic effect will be applied.

Contains:

- Base game in a unique box edition
- Expansion cycle I: Rise of the East & Dawn of Amazonia
- Expansion cycle II: Wind of the Dunes & Tide of Atlantis 
- All unlocked stretch goals

Stretch Goals:

- Sturdier cards
- Alternative art for the Spirits of Light
- One size of the Hero card will be printed with silver ink

Name: 2nd Fleet: Expansion
Description:
At the start of a project, the first two questions a wargame designer asks himself are: what is the area I wish to in the game, and at what scale do I show it? 2nd FLEET, which is a follow-on game to the successful 6th FLEET, was irrevocably tied to the scale of its older cousin (roughly 50 miles per hex). The emphasis of the new game is on carrier operations in the Norwegian Sea; the two maps used in the game are centered on the North Atlantic, from Greenland to Norway (on an east-west axis) and from the Kola Peninsula to the northern tip of Ireland (on a south-north axis). Even using two maps, the "southern approaches" to the British Isles (that is, the sea route skirting the southern Irish coast) had to be omitted from the game due to space constraints. Since an important part of the simulation deals with the movement of convoys from the United States and Canada to Europe, the realism of 2nd FLEET can be enhanced if the NATO player is permitted to use the slower but safer southern approach to Europe for his convoys.

Using the expansion map, counters and rules included in this article, 2nd FLEET players will have more maneuver room for their surface and submarine units. (But unfortunately, will have less maneuver room on their dining room tables!) As a result, both players' strategic options will be increased. Moreover, each side will have more units to play with. since the addition of the southern approaches will also add some naval forces that had been omitted from the original game-most importantly, the powerful French Atlantic squadron.

The expansion was included in Avalon Hill's in-house published magazine the "General" in Volume 25, Issue 1 (their 25th anniversary issue).

—description from the publisher

Name: Boba Boss
Description:
Boba Boss is a fast-paced, brain-twisting, color and word association game. The game is crazy simple and easy to figure out. It takes less than a minute to learn and even less time than that to play it. A round can be over in mere seconds!

Boba Boss can be played with 2 to 6 people, but packing the table to the max is more fun. Everyone plays as an employee at a boba tea shop. Your goal is to win employee of the minute, by filling all of your your seven tea cups before anyone else finishes filling theirs. Complicating the situation a little is the fact that not only are players filling their own cups, they’re also spilling their opponents cups at the same time.

The game cleverly employs the stroop effect to test players' deciphering abilities and reaction times. Insani-tea is  inevitable and that's a big part of the fun. The cute boba ball theme and the delightfully simple game play make this game accessible to most anyone who isn't afraid to rub elbows at the table.

Do you have what it takes to become the Boba Boss?

—description from the publisher

Name: Suburbia: Collector's Edition – Man vs. Meeple Studios
Description:
Originally available as part of the Kickstarter for the Suburbia: Collector's Edition.
Later this tile was part of Man vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter.

A tile that can be added to the Nightlife expansion.

Name: Empress: Fight To the Top
Description:
Empress is a world of exotic steam and punk in which a one-eyed despot rules supreme. It is a world of indentured peons and hardworking mules, traveling tinker bands and perspiring fixers bathed in furnace glow. Merchantmen anchor off far-flung ports while rank upon rank of Her Majesty's rifles assemble in faceless obedience. A darkened corner could turn up one of Turing's programmatic spies while, ensconced underground, seers break through into a kaleidoscope of forbidden futures. Here, there are dukes (one mad), princelings with dark pasts and kings and queens of uncertain allegiance. Overhead, her Highness's trusted fighting aces rule the skies; beneath, her elephantine automatons shake the very ground.

In this realm, the all-seeing, all-knowing tentacles of the Great Empress reach far and wide. So wide, in fact, that many have despaired of freedom and—at a glance of her one baleful eye—life itself. But there is hope: a tale overheard in the fevered ruminations of a nameless prophet speaks of a day when one of her subjects will approach the throne, wrench the cephalopodic scepter from her grasp and end the reign of terror. But who?

Welcome to Empress, a climbing game of cunning, strategy and power. The premise? Be the first to shed all of your cards and ascend the throne of the Great Empress. But beware—a tragic misstep and you could find yourself wallowing in drudgery as a Peon or Mule. Empress may be played with any number of players from 2 to 8 (add a second deck for 5 or more).

—description from the publisher

Name: Ein Altes Kriegsspiel
Description:
A wargame played on a square grid using square cardboard tokens for representing military units. It was played around 1809-1820 at the Plebanischen Institute in Wien and was probably designed by a teacher or student(s) there. The rules were written down by an Austrian army officer A.P Reyer and published under the name "Ein Altes Kriegsspiel" (that translates to "An Old Wargame") in 1858. The rulebook also contains drawings showing an example game board and images that can be used for painting the units, although they are not to scale or complete, so players are expected to construct their own components rather than cut out the images from the book.

The book retained the original theme from the game as played in the 1810's, with images showing Napoleonic war era uniforms and weapons.

—user summary

Name: Time Editors
Description:
2-4 Players
Ages 12+
30 min. per player

SUMMARY:
In the year 2475 world nations race to save the past and control the use of time travel.

STORY:
The amount of anomalies created through time travel in the 25th century has become a major world concern. The FTCN (Federation of Time-Traveling Capable Nations) has voted that all nations must give up their time travel capabilities. A single task force of “time editors” (agents that specialize in changing the timeline) will be kept on standby in the event that they are needed to save humanity from any possible future disasters. Only the nation with the most skilled time editors will retain their use of time travel. The task force of time editors will be chosen through a “time editing” trial. The first nation to prevent four disastrous past events will retain the use of time travel and will have command of the official global task force of time editors.â€‹

PLAY:
The game is a blend of:
• resource and economy management
• a worker placement system in the present and past
• storytelling

To win the game you must prevent 4 disastrous events in the past from happening.
 Player mats have two halves - past and present. People and resources you take to the past can only be used in the past. People and resources you keep in the present can only be used in the present. Each player has 4 types of time editing specialists: Science, Technology, Military, and Politics. Specialists have unique abilities when they are in the present, but when they travel back in time to change the past you lose their abilities in the present.

You can send 1 to 4 specialists back in time if you have the necessary resources. Sending multiple, or all, at once will reduce the wormhole resources needed by reducing the number of time jumps (1 per turn). But keeping some specialists in the present will allow you to use their abilities to strengthen your economy, intelligence, and undermine other nations. Who and when you send where is your choice!

Each player is given unique disasters in the past that they will need to prevent. (There are 16 time lines with 80 unique events). In order to change the time line and prevent a disaster, you must change the events leading up to the disaster. Certain specialists are needed to change specific events but you can decide which event you travel to. Attempts at changing the time line involve storytelling (a game tester favorite!) and pulling tiles to create ripples through time.

In order to time travel and pay specialists to change the past, you will need an economy. There are over 130 possible economic setups with variable risk/reward factors. Players explore planets, build mining colonies, mine resources and transport them to Earth. Planets further from Earth have richer mining deposits but will take longer to reach (unless you can afford to create wormholes or pay to use other players’ wormholes).

Resources can only be used once they are returned to Earth, so you will need to plan ahead multiple turns for where/when your time ship will be and which specialists are where/when. Resources can be used to buy items for your economy, buy action cards (draw 3 & choose 1), open wormholes in space (for faster travel to planets), open wormholes in time (to change the past), pay time editing specialists to change the past, or hire A. I. to give you the probability of causing a time ripple.

—description from the publisher

Name: Jogakbo
Description:
In Jogakbo, a.k.a. ì¡°ê°ë³´ (Korean for "patchwork"), you are a member of the Seolbo Artisan Group — "ì„¤" (seol) referring to both harmony and a piece of silk — and your group has been challenged to assemble a beautiful quilt from whatever silk pieces they have available in their shops. Who will create the most harmonious quilt that satisfies the client's demands?

To set up, each player receives their own 8x8 game board, playing on either the easy or normal side of the board. The board features a 2x2 central space as well as a number of holes and spots for ornamentation. You lay out two main order cards and one secondary order card at random, along with 5-9 pieces of silk cloth in the four colors, adjusting the quantity based on the player count. Additionally, you have high-quality silk patches that cover either a 1x1 or 2x1 space, with these pieces being of a fifth and sixth color. Place one piece of silk of the main four colors on the matching spaces on the market board. Give each player three coins, with the start player taking an additional coin.

On a turn, you can either move the token on the market board to a different color and take the silk piece and any coins from this space, or pay 2 coins to choose any silk piece from the main four colors, whether from the market board or in the reserves. (The start player can place the token on any of the four colors on the first turn.) You then place the silk on your board. Your first piece must cover at least one square in the center of your game board; each subsequent piece must lie orthogonally adjacent to a piece already on your board, and pieces of the same color cannot be adjacent to one another!

If you cover an ornament space on your board, you can pay a coin to take a high-quality silk piece and place it on your board. If you cover another ornament space, you can do this again. To end your turn, (if needed) choose a silk piece from the reserve of the same color that you took and place it on the market board, then place a coin from the bank on any market space that doesn't have the token in it.

Whenever you achieve a secondary order during play, such as covering a hole with high-quality silk or placing a second piece of the same shape, you receive a bonus immediately.

After eight rounds, the game ends. You receive a bonus based on how well you completed the main orders, such as creating a silk-filled square or filling the diagonals of your board. Additionally, each filled vertical or horizontal line is worth 3 points, each uncovered ornament 1 point, each hole -1 point, and each coin 1 point as long as you have at least three coins. Whoever has the highest score wins.

Name: LOTTO
Description:
Each lottery master has different methods to get the prize number but getting the number aren't enough. They also need to find the Lotto with that number. Only the fastest one will get that Lotto. It doesn't matter how much Lottos you buy. The only thing that matters is what lottery number will be drawn.
" Hold on your cards and Win the lottery in LOTTO. "

Setup
1. Each Player takes a set of Number cards with the same color.
2. Randomly select 16 Lotto cards for the game and put the remaining cards in the box.
3. Place selected cards face-down in the middle of table.

How to play
1. Draw 1 Lotto card and place it face-up next to the deck. 
2. Each player shuffles their Number cards face-down.
3. When everyone is ready. 1 player starts
Countdown from 3 then look at their Number cards
and try to make a stack of cards that satisfy condition
of the revealed Lotto card.
4. When you finished making stack reach, out and try to place your hand on the Lotto card as fast as you can. First player to reach the lotto card wins the card.
5. Other players can decide to Challenge. That means the challenger thinks your stack is not satisfy the condition. If there are multiple Challengers, discuss until there’s only one challenger.
• If the stack is Incorrect (ex. wrong number , wrong order ,or cards not on the stack) The challenger take that Lotto instead and also randomly take
1 Lotto card from the challenged Player. If that player doesn’t have any Lotto card, that player can’t take the Lotto during next round (But he can still Challenge)
• If the stack is correct, the challenged player still take that Lotto card and randomly take Lotto card from challenger. If that player doesn’t have any Lotto card, that player can’t take the Lotto during next round (But can still Challenge)
6. Each player takes their Number cards back and reveal the next Lotto card.
The game ends when all 16 Lotto cards are taken.

Name: The Legend of Drimek
Description:
The Legend of Drimek is a co-operative board game for 2-4 players in which you take control of one of the heroes from the kingdom of Drimek, one of the four allies that live to search for treasures and relics in the depths of the dungeons.

But one day, they discover an open gate that had been closed for centuries. When they access the dungeon and collect all the treasures, they accidentally wake up an evil necromancer from its slumber, who entraps them in the testing grounds. That's why our heroes must find a way to escape the testing grounds, by cooperating to fight and solve the different tests that each level will throw at them to return to their home. It seems like the testing grounds' legend is true. The Legend of Drimek is real.

—description from the publisher

Name: Reboot
Description:
After a Roborg or Robotic Battlefield Operator for Recon and General purpose had raised against human and destroyed all humanity, but something important for the Roborg also disappears.
That is “Energy” enough to operate all Roborg. So all Roborg have started the new war to take control of the last man made energy source. Every Robrog has to fight it out there is only 1 left and also try to survive through all the disasters that happen. If they shut down once they will never start up again. Which Roborg will able to survive and take all the energy?  maybe REBOOT is the only thing Roborg

After the battle with losing of humanity, all the Roborgs still not having the "Energy" they wish to survive.
The war of Roborgs for the last energy source begins again, but not only to fight each other, they also have to fight with natural disasters which had all the Roborgs cornered.
Maybe "Rebooting" is the only thing all Roborgs need...

Set up
1. Place Main Board on the table and distribute  Roborg Board to each player and put their energy marker on the 12 slot
2. Place 4 wall on each middle spot of the SAFE ZONE(middle section) edge and place 1 wall on other borderline(yellow line)  and then randomly place 
   all the wall and any line except inside or borderline of SAFE ZONE 
   a. Each wall can only connect to 1 another wall
   b. You can’t make the close space 
3. Randomly place 5 Retrieve Component Tokens on every section except in SAFE ZONE and on the start point of this round 
4. Player who have the most robot will take the 1st player cube and be the first to choose his/her spawn point (depending on the player size) and next player in clockwise order choosing until every player have done

Item Card 
1. Card Type
     a. Equipment Melee Weapon/Shield can’t hold in hand you must equip it immediately if you already equipped that type of Equipment you can decide 
        to either discard the newly draw one or replace current equipment and put the old equipment at the bottom of the drawing deck
           i. Shield can take only damage form the attack
     b. Ranged Weapon when use place it at the bottom of the item deck
     c. Reusable Ranged Weapon If successfully make an attack with this card return this card to your hand if fall  place it at the bottom of the 
        item deck
     d. ENERGY can use in 2 ways
           i.  When you fail on you attack you can discard this card to +1 of your dice result you can use as many energy as you have
           ii. In your turn you can spend 1 action to play this card and increase your ENERGY equal to number on the card and then place it at the 
               bottom of the item deck
2. This card can make an attack through the wall
3. This indicate the dice value you need to roll to make an attack
4. This is the range for the attack


    Each player never have item card in their hand more than 4 cards and they must discard until they have 4 cards before continue playing
         If card used >> place it at the bottom of the item deck
            If card unused >> place it at the discard pile
        
    


Action 
In each round start from a player with 1st player cube, Player can spend a maximum of 3 actions the same action can be repeated after players finished their turn player the player on their left starts their turn. When every player finished their turn, The player with the 1st player cube flip all face down disaster tokens and random select 1 disaster token and place on any section except SAFE ZONE after that reveal 1 event card and resolve its effect (detail on page 7). Pass 1st player cube to the player on the left and start the next round
     
   1. Move
      a. Use 1 action to move 1 space orthogonality can’t move through the wall
   2. Use energy card
      b. Use 1 action to play ENERGY card from hand to increase Roborg ENERGY equal to value to on the card then put it on the bottom of the deck
   3. Attack
      a. Player must first declare an attack and select a target and then select a weapon card(* * these symbols) and place it face down in front of 
         you if you want to attack with Melee weapon you can select any card on your hand instead  after you finish the target can decide to do a 
         counter-attack and select a card from their hand but they can also select  an ENERGY card instead to increase their ENERGY after attacker 
         finish their attack
      b. When both players ready, reveal their face-down card at the same time if you decide to do an Unarmored or Melee attack take your face down card 
         back to your hand without reveal it. Start from the attacker rolls a die if die value equal or exceed requirement on the card that attack 
         is successful defender receive damage indicate on the card and if the attack is successful the defender is being knock back 1 space and then 
         start a counter-attack if their attack still in range
      c. When an attack failed you can use ENERGY card to +1 value of a die you can use multiple ENERGY cards at once
      d. When you roll a 6  it’s a CRITICAL HIT, your attack deal x2 damage but  5 + 1 ENERGY card does not count as CRITICAL HIT
      e. When Roborg Energy go below 0 they’re destroyed and don’t do a counter-attack
      f. After player finishes an attack their turn ends even if they still have action left

Roborg got attacked with ** and must lose 5 ENERGY but he has armor with 4 value so and decides to put 2 damage on the armor by put Broken Armor Tokens on the armor and lose 3 ENERGY and if a number of broken armor token equal the value on card remove it from player board and place it at bottom of the deck

A1 SEXY ROBOT GIRL declare an attack on LUCKY ROBO BOY and roll a die successfully make an attack and LUCKY ROBO BOY get knock back in the same 
         direction of the attack 1 space
      A2 LUCKY ROBO BOY didn’t has any armor so he loses 3 ENERGY and left with only 1 ENERGY

A3 LUCKY ROBO BOY use ENERGY card as a counter-attack so he gains 2 ENERGY

B1 SEXY ROBOT GIRL declare an attack on SATAN MACHINE and successfully roll

B2 SATAN MACHINE doesn’t have any card on hand so he can’t counter-attack, but he has armor so he decides to put 3 Broken Armor Tokens on 
         armor instead of losing his ENERGY
   Type of Attack 
      1. Unarmored Attack
          a. Range 0
          b. Damage 1
          c. No knock back
          d. Can only use when you don’t equip a Melee weapon
          e. No dice roll
      2. Melee Weapon Attack
          a. Range 0-1
          b. Damage 2-3
          c. Knock back
          d. Don’t discard when used
      3. Ranged Weapon Attack
          a. Range 0-3
          b. Damage 3-5
          c. Knock back
                i.  If attack successful take it back to your hand
                ii. Can attack through wall or other Roborg

Knock back from the attack
    When Roborg get hit they will always get push 1 space but can’t push out of the main board or though the wall if after got pushed and the attacker not in range of the attack anymore, it counts as your attack missed

1. If attack from the same space(Range 0) attacker can decide where the target will get knock back to
   2. If you use Weapon Attack Target will get knock back 1 space in same direction as the attack
   3. There will be no knock back there a wall behind the target

Free Action
   1. If you are in the same space with a Retrieve Token you can reveal it and resolve it effect
   2. You can discard any number of cards you want to the discard pile and then put Lost Component Token on your space 
      a. You can't discard when your space already have any token on it
   3. If you are in the same space with a Lost Component Token you can take it and randomly draw an item from the discard pile 
      a. You can’t take Lost Component Token that  just adds on this turn
   4. When you have no cards in hand When in the Search space you can draw 2 cards from the deck you can only use this action once per turn and if 
      you draw an Equipment card you must equip the newly draw one 
      a. You can’t discard or place a token on this space

         In each section can only have 5 tokens at once and each space can only have 1 token
    


Disaster Token
    When everyone finishes their turn playing with the 1st player cube randomly select a disaster token and place it face-down on any section except SAFE ZONE and reveal the previous face-down disaster token 
    When the disaster token is revealed each Roborg in that section lost ENERGY equal to the value of tokens in that section 
    When Roborg enter the section with revealed disaster token (either by a move in or get knock back ) will lose ENERGY equal to value on tokens in that section 
    When the last disaster token is revealed place the addition -1 ENERGY tokens on each section except SAFE ZONE and remove 4 walls around SAFE ZONE out of the game

Red 1
In the 8 round of the game player with the 1st player cube select last disaster token and place it face-down and reveal the previous face-down disaster token, Yellow and Purple each lost 1 ENERGY because they section have revealed token, Red and Green didn’t lose ENERGY yet

Red 2
In the 9 round of the game player with the 1st player cube reveal the last face-down disaster token and then place -1 ENERGY Token on each section except SAFE ZONE and remove the walls around SAFE ZONE then every Roborg outside SAFE ZONE lost ENERGY equal total value of Tokens

Event card

After player place disaster on the main board and resolve effect from revealed disaster tokens draw an event card from event deck and reveal it to all players and resolve it effect starting from player with 1st player cube and still have effect until the next round card is revealed. You don’t draw new  if there is no disaster token placed down

1. Each player randomly stole a card from the hand of the player on their left at the same time
   2. Each player randomly stole a card from the hand of the player on their right at the same time
   3. Each player lost ENERGY equal to the number of cards in their hand
